column4: is it possible for ubuntu to auto-detect when an external monitor is plugged into a laptop and use it as a second display?
yes from dapper it should just work
make sure you have it plugged in when you start up the comp
oh you want it as a dual display?
do you know what kind of vid card you are using?
did you not see my question?
I did, hold on a second
0000:01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon R250 Lf [FireGL 9000]  (rev 01) (prog-if 00 [VGA] )
so, I'll have to manually edit xorg.conf whenever I want to use an external monitor?
you dont have to do it everytime
just once is enough if its the same monitor
how do I determine the identifier for the monitor then?
I looked in the device manager and see nothing identifying any monitors
I looked in the device manager and see nothing identifying any monitors
